result.execSummary:
The defendant John P Hanson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
At the times of exchange of the child, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  
Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC. 
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant John P Hanson appeared in court. 
District Attorney John Snider : Present. 
Statements by DA Snider. 
Defendant maintains his waiver to counsel. 
No contest plea entered. 
Plea accepted after rights explained and defendant is found guilty. 
State is in compliance with victim notifications. 
Recommendations by DA Snider. 
Sentenced to 30 days jail with Huber privileges, imposed/stayed, ordered 1 year probation. 
Conditions: 
- pay costs, including DOMAB 
- pay supervision fees 
- submit to assessments/counseling and abide by recommendations 
- at the times of exchange of the child, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety 
Must report to office of P&P today. 
Appeal rights explained.

Defendant questioned by the Court and advised of rights.
